Variable Names Not Needed


We are tending towards assign-once variables.


Why do we need variable names, if the variables are not variables?


Example:


plus( b : integer, c : integer) : integer


becomes


plus (integer, integer) : integer


and, in the presence of type synonyms, becomes


plus (b, c) : a


a = integer

b = integer

c = integer



[N.B. in the last case, the checker can insist on unique names for all parameters and return types.Â  This, IMO, is makes the checker simpler, while preserving DI.][1]

[1] Design Intent
